title: Ilona Palásti
summary: Ilona Palásti (1924–1991) was a Hungarian mathematician who worked at the Alfréd Rényi Institute of Mathematics. She is known for her research in discrete geometry, geometric probability, and the theory of random graphs.[1] With Alfréd Rényi and others, she was considered to be one of the members of the Hungarian School of Probability.[2]
